_header: O glorious Martyr which of devout humbless
Subjects: Edmund, saint, prayer to; Henry VI, prayer on behalf of; prayers, special occasions; prayers, to saints
_description: John Lydgate, Prayer to St. Edmund on behalf of Henry VI — eight 8-line stanzas

BodAsh46.First Lines:
O gloryous martir which of devout humblesseffor Crystes sake wer
                    bounde to a treeWith shot of Arwes suffredyst greet duresseThy blood
                    doun Rayllyng that Routhe it was to see…
BodAsh46.Last Lines:
…Long to preserve in his victoryous seAs Iust Enherytour of
                    Ingelond and ffraunce

BodAsh59.First Lines:
Glorious martir þat of devout humblesseffor Crystes sake wer
                    bounden til a treeWith shotte of arowes sufferd gret duresseþy
                    blode dovne rayled þat rouþe it was to see…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…Longe to presever in his victorious seeAs iouste herytier of
                    Englande and ffraunce
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here foloweþe a balade ryal of Invocacoun to saint Edmunde at
                    þinstance of kynge Henry þe sixst made by Lidgate (f.
                    22v)

BodTan347.First Lines:
[O] gloryous martir which of devout humblesseffor crystes sake wer
                    bounde to a tre…
BodTan347.Last Lines:
…Long to perseuere in his victoryous seAs Iuste inherytour of
                    yngelond and off ffraunce

OxfCCC61.First Lines:
Glorious Martir Whiche of deuout Humblesffor cristis sake were
                    bounde to a tree…
OxfCCC61.Last Lines:
…Longe to perseuer in his victorious seeAs Iust inheritour of
                    England & of ffraunce

CULEe215.First Lines:
O Gloryous Martyr wiche of deuout humblesffor crystys sake were
                    bond to a tre…
CULEe215.Last Lines:
…long to perseuere In hys victoryous seeAs Iust enheritoure of
                    ynglond & fraunce

BLHar367.First Lines:
Glorious mastir that of devout humblenessefor christis sake was
                    bounden till a tree…
BLHar367.Last Lines:
…longe to persever in his victoriouse seeas Iust inheritor of
                    England and ffraunce
BLHar367.Note: Written by the hand of John Stow.
BLHar367.Attributed Title:
here folowith a ballad Royall of Invocation to seint Edmond at thenstaunce
                    of kynge harry the sixt made by lidgate (by scribe, John Stow, f. 86)

BLHar372.First Lines:
O gloryous martir which of deuout humblessefor cristis sake were
                    bounde to a tre…
BLHar372.Last Lines:
…Beth to his chirche diffence & chaumpiounBe cause it is
                    of youre ffundacioun
BLHar372.Note:
Lydgate, Prayer to St Edmund, eight or nine 8-line stanzas (this
                    manuscript copy has 8 stanzas rhyming ababbcbc plus six-stanza rhyme royal
                    envoy; has heading ‘To the Kyng’ in left margin beside last stanza
                    of envoy (f. 43v).
BLHar372.Attributed Title:
Oracio ad beatam Martirem (f. 42v, left margin next to
                    first line)

BLHar2278.First Lines: O Gloryous martir which off deuout humblesseffor crystes sake were bounde to a tre…
BLHar2278.Last Lines: …Longe to perseuere in his victorious seAs iust enheritour off Ingelond and ffrance

Chetham6709.First Lines:
O Gloryous Martyr Which of devoute humblesseffor Crystes sake were
                    bounde to A TreeWyth shotte of Arowes suffredest greete duresseThy
                    Bloode down Raylyd þat rowth it was to see…
Chetham6709.Last Lines:
…Long to preserve In his victoryus seeAs luste Enherytoure of
                    ynglond & ffraunce
Chetham6709.Note:
Followed by one rhyme royal stanza, ‘Goo lytyll
                    Booke…’ envoye to St Edmund: see 5422
